diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe abdominal pain localized in the RUQ, elevated liver function tests (ALT 1483, AST 1059, T Bili 4.2), and other clinical signs such as dark urine and pale stools, consistent with cholestasis and pancreatitis. Imaging findings corroborated hepatic steatosis and portal vein thrombosis, further supporting the diagnosis of pancreatitis.
